p: Here we aim to track a nearly linear feature, which are known to be efficiently detected by the Hough transform. The Hough transform is widely used in image analysis and computer vision [ 39]. It is commonly used for indexing Kikuchi patterns collected using electron back-scattered diffraction (EBSD) [ 40]. It has also been used previously in three-dimensions to reveal the presence of atomic planes within the atom probe reconstruction [ 14, 41]. In this work, the Hough transform implementation is based on Python open-cv package [ 38]. Fig 7(a) shows that linear features can be detected using the Hough transform algorithm within the tracking window, and hence used to refine the feature selection inside the ROI.
